description: The AP-02 Regional Transport Office serves the Anantapuramu district in Andhra Pradesh. Although the state transitioned to a unified AP-39 registration series in 2019, this office continues to manage legacy registrations and regional transport services for the Anantapur area.
address: Regional Transport Office, Bhairava Nagar, Near JNTU Engineering College, Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh

description: The AP-03 RTO serves the Chittoor district in Andhra Pradesh, managing vehicle registration, driving licenses, and transport permits for the region. While the state transitioned to a unified AP-39 registration series for new vehicles in 2019, AP-03 remains the active legacy code and administrative identifier for the Chittoor RTO office.
address: No. 1 & 2, Industrial Estate, Puttur Road, Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-04 is the Regional Transport Office for the YSR Kadapa district in Andhra Pradesh. Although the state shifted to a unified AP-39 code for all new registrations in 2019, this office remains the primary administrative hub for legacy vehicle records and licensing services in the Kadapa region.
address: Uttukur, Chintha Komma Dinne Mandal, Kadapa, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-05 is the legacy Regional Transport Office code for Kakinada in the East Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh. While the state transitioned to a centralized registration system (AP-39) in 2019 to streamline administration, this code remains active for servicing vehicles registered before the change. Its jurisdiction covers the port city of Kakinada and surrounding agricultural and industrial hubs like Amalapuram and Pithapuram.
address: RTO Office, Kakinada-Pithapuram Road, Near Collectorate, Kakinada, East Godavari, Andhra Pradesh

description: The AP-06 RTO is located in Amalapuram and serves the Konaseema region of Andhra Pradesh. Although the state transitioned to a centralized registration system (AP-39/AP-40) in 2019, the AP-06 code remains valid for existing registrations and historical records handled by the Amalapuram office.
address: Regional Transport Office, Amalapuram, Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema District, Andhra Pradesh

description: The AP-07 RTO serves the Guntur district in Andhra Pradesh, handling vehicle registration, licensing, and transport permits. Although the state transitioned to a centralized AP-39 code in 2019 for new registrations, this RTO remains active for the maintenance of existing AP-07 records and regional transport administration.
address: Regional Transport Office, J.K.C College Road, Swarnabharathi Nagar, Guntur, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-08 is a legacy registration code for the Guntur Regional Transport Office in Andhra Pradesh. While the state moved to a unified AP-39 series for all new registrations in 2019, this office remains active for administrative duties, licensing, and management of existing vehicles registered under this series.
address: JKC College Road, Swarnabharathi Nagar, Guntur, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-09 is a legacy RTO code originally assigned to the Hyderabad Central region (Khairatabad) in unified Andhra Pradesh. Following the 2014 state bifurcation, this office is now under the Telangana Transport Department and issues registrations under the TG-09/TS-09 series, while existing AP-09 vehicles remain valid.
